qas.question: On what day did the CRTC agree to allow CBCs broadcasting transmitters to remain active for another year?
Where could CBC's channels need to be relocated in order to continue operating?
Which of CBC's channels were required to be relocated or reduced in power?
When did the courts hear the case regarding the August 31st deadline?
What was agreed upon by the CBC and CRTC as a fair date to extend the deadline to?
The CRTC stated that the CBC refused to move their operating channels from what positions?
The CRTC stated that the CBC  refused to relocate and reduce in power what channels?

context: On <a0_0><b3_0>August 18, 2011<b3_0/><a0_0/>, the CRTC issued a decision that allows CBC's mandatory market rebroadcasting transmitters in analogue to remain on-air until <b4_0>August 31, 2012<b4_0/>. Before that deadline, CBC's licence renewal process would take place and CBC's digital transition plans would be examined as part of that process. The requirement remains for all of CBC's full-power transmitters occupying channels <a2_0><b6_0>52 to 69<b6_0/><a2_0/> to either relocate to channels <a1_0><b5_0>2 to 51<b5_0/><a1_0/> or become low-power transmitters. In some cases, CBC has opted to reduce the power of existing transmitters to low-power transmitters, which will result in signal loss for some viewers.
